title: Request for Incident at 25th Precinct on April 19th, 2023 Involving Officer Justin (Badge Number 9991) and Other Officers.

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Request for Incident at 25th Precinct on April 19th, 2023 Involving Officer Justin (Badge Number 9991) and Other Officers.
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Pertaining to an incident that occurred at the 25th precinct around 9:50 pm on April 19th, 2023, involving Officer Justin (badge number 9991) and any other officers involved in the incident.

Specifically, I am requesting all complaints filed against these officers for the past 2 years, as well as any depositions and complaint records related to this incident. I am particularly interested in any records related to any officer who claimed that recording in public is wrongful or any officer who accosted a member of the public for recording in public.

In addition, I am requesting any video recordings, including body camera footage and lobby footage, related to this incident. I request that you do not withhold or redact any records, and I would appreciate it if you could provide me with any case law that supports your decision to release these records.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to receiving the requested records in a timely manner.

Sincerely,

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jordan Lassiter
